block.p: Marin Parker Connor, a daughter of Susan Scholle Connor and John T. Connor Jr. of Lake Wales, Fla., was married yesterday to Andrew Alasdair Smith, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence Smith of St. Andrews, Scotland. The Rev. Richard Wendel, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of Our Saviour in Chicago.

The bride, 29, was until March an associate producer on ''The Oprah Winfrey Show'' in Chicago. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a director and the board secretary of Port.Ru, a Russian Web search site, and the manager of the Third Millennium Russia Fund, a mutual fund. Her mother retired as a vice president and the general counsel of Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Jersey in Newark.

Marin Parker Connor, a daughter of Susan Scholle Connor and John T. Connor Jr. of Lake Wales, Fla., was married yesterday to Andrew Alasdair Smith, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence Smith of St. Andrews, Scotland. The Rev. Richard Wendel, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of Our Saviour in Chicago.

The bride, 29, was until March an associate producer on ''The Oprah Winfrey Show'' in Chicago. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a director and the board secretary of Port.Ru, a Russian Web search site, and the manager of the Third Millennium Russia Fund, a mutual fund. Her mother retired as a vice president and the general counsel of Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Jersey in Newark.
The bride's grandfather John T. Connor was the Commerce Secretary from 1965 to 1967.

The bridegroom, 32, is the vice president for administration in the Chicago office of Murray Johnstone, an asset management company. His father retired as a civil engineer in Dumbarton, Scotland, for the British government.
